oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Portrait of Confederate surgeon Robert W. Mitchell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Head and shoulders oil portrait of a gentleman believed to be Dr. Robert Wood Mitchell (1831-1917). Mitchell served as surgeon in the 13th Tenn. Inf. Regt. CSA. He was appointed in 1861 and paroled in 1865 at Mobile. Born in Madison Co., Tenn., he lived and practiced most of his adult life in Memphis. He wed Rebecca F. Park in 1872. During the 1878 yellow fever epidemic, Mitchell was the Howard Association medical director. He was revered among his peers in the Miss. Valley.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
